and it comes down to when you have a number of values inside of a database
when you need to find a value from that on a classical way you need to visit all
of the items in the database you need to look at all of them until you actually find it so the the order of complexity is always
going to be n so if you have more items it will take you longer to find um an item in that list on a quantum
computer thanks to grover's algorithm we can do this more quickly grover's algorithm can find
an item in a list of items in an order of complexity of square root of n so it's
exponential exponentially faster and it doesn't need to visit all of the items at the same time but it
